revised_title: A Novel Magnetic Detector for Hertzian Waves: A Quantitative Approach
tldr: The author presents a new magnetic detector for Hertzian waves that can be used for quantitative experiments. The device consists of iron wire bundles, magnetizing and demagnetizing coils, and a rotating commutator. This detector can be employed to compare the wave-making power of different radiators and investigate the transparency or opacity of various substances to Hertzian waves.
